attribute_definition: A numeric id for the measurment the metadata belongs to (starting with 1 and increasing by 1).
An integer value representing the number of scans.
A numeric value representing the detection gain factor.
A numeric value representing the scan speed.
A numeric value representing the wavenumber of the laser.
A string representing the name of the detector.
A string representing the name of the infrared radiation source.
A numeric value representing the duration of purge delay before a measurement in seconds.
An integer value representing the zero filling factor.
A string representing the name of the apodisation function.
A numeric value representing the exponentiation factor used for file compression.
A numeric value representing the number of data points in the spectrum.
A string representing the type of the x variable.
A string representing the type of the y variable.
A datetime representing the dat and time when the spectrum was measured.
A string representing the name of the measurement device.
A datetime representing the dat and time when the reference (background) spectrum was measured when a separate background spectrum is available in the file.
An integer value representing the sample repetition number.
A string representing the name of the beamsplitter.
A numeric value representing the temperature of the scanner during the measurement of the sample.
A numeric value representing the temperature of the scanner during the measurement of the reference (background).
A numeric value representing the relative humidity during measurement of the sample.
A numeric value representing the relative humidity during measurement of the reference (background).
A numeric value representing the absolute humidity during measurement of the sample.
A numeric value representing the absolute humidity during measurement of the reference (background).
A string representing the measurement mode in which the mid infrared spectra were measured. One of “absorbance_ftir”, “atr_ftir”, “dr_ftir”.
A logical value indicating if a spectrum is already baseline corrected (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
A numeric value representing the relative noise level of a mid infrared spectrum.

A numeric value representing the relative water vapor contribution to a mid infrared spectrum. This is the slope of an ordinary least squares regression model fitting a reference water vapor spectrum to a specified range of the spectrum.

A numeric value representing the relative carbon dioxide contribution to a mid infrared spectrum. This is the slope of an ordinary least squares regression model fitting a reference carbon dioxide spectrum to a specified range of the spectrum.

A numeric value representing an uncertainty estimate for the relative water vapor contribution to a mid infrared spectrum. This is the standard deviation of the slope of an ordinary least squares regression model fitting a reference water vapor spectrum to a specified range of the spectrum.

A numeric value representing an uncertainty estimate for the relative carbon dioxide contribution to a mid infrared spectrum. This is the standard deviation of the slope of an ordinary least squares regression model fitting a reference carbon dioxide spectrum to a specified range of the spectrum.
A numeric value representing the minimum x variable value of each spectrum.
A numeric value representing the maximum x variable value of each spectrum.
